node.title: Call for Queensland's disability support workers to be mandated to get COVID-19 vaccine
node.alt: Smiling photo of eight-year-old Harrison Williams, who has muscular dystrophy.
node.description: Eight-year-old Harrison can't use a mask, wash his hands or socially distance from others to keep safe from COVID-19. ButÂ his risk of exposure is heightened because the people taking care of him don't have to be vaccinated.
node.content:
["Eight-year-old Harrison Williams can't use a mask, wash his hands, or socially distance from others, to keep himself safe from COVID-19.", "The Gold Coast boy has a rare form of muscular dystrophy\u00a0and he relies on support workers for everyday tasks\u00a0like eating, showering and going to school.", "But in Queensland, the people taking care of him do not have to be vaccinated against COVID-19.", "His mother, Linda Williams, said her son was already one of the most at risk of catching the illness and dying from it.", "\"If Harrison caught COVID, his respiratory system would be affected and he would be one of the people that would be in ICU,\" she said.", "Queensland is one of the few places in Australia where vaccination is not already \u2014 or soon to be mandated \u2014\u00a0for disability support workers.", "New South Wales, Western Australia, Victoria, Northern Territory and the Australian Capital Territory have directives in place.", "", "
Linda Williams\u00a0said her son was already one of the most at risk of catching\u00a0and dying from COVID-19.(Supplied)
", "
'Matter of life or death'
", "Prominent disability advocacy groups have argued there was no justifiable reason for a similar order to not be imposed by the Queensland government.", "Queensland Advocacy Incorporated spokeswoman Matilda Alexander said,\u00a0\"this is a matter of life or death\".", "Ms Williams said she feared the risk to her son would heighten\u00a0when Queensland's borders were opened from next month.", "Health authorities had already warned cases and deaths would spike in Queensland\u00a0after the restrictions were eased from December 17.", "\"It's scary to think that,\" Ms Williams said.", "", "
Ms Williams said she feared the risk to her son would heighten\u00a0when Queensland's borders were reopened.(Supplied)
", "Similar easing of restrictions overseas had seen people with a disability being disproportionately killed by the virus.", "In England, six out of 10 deaths involving coronavirus last year\u00a0were in people with a disability.", "\"No family should have to choose between getting adequate support and getting safe support,\" Ms Alexander said.", "\"Every family should be able to get appropriate supports\u00a0and know their loved ones are safe.\"", "", "
Harrison relies on support workers for everyday tasks\u00a0like eating, showering and going to school.(Supplied)
", "In a statement, a Department of Health spokesperson said although a health directive had been made from all of its clinical and non-clinical staff, a separate public health order would be needed for disability workers.", "\"Queensland Health may consider extending the mandate to vulnerable people and/or settings,\" the spokesperson said.", "", "
